tests.question: for company Paradigm Health, list all rounds, the date, valuation, lead investor, and article source
tests.reasoning: The agent followed a reasonable and defensible approach: it searched the organizations table for variants of 'paradigm' using both the SEARCH helper and a LOWER(name) LIKE query, returned plausible candidate organization records, and explicitly asked a clarifying question because it could not confidently identify a single 'Paradigm Health' organization in the dataset. That is appropriate given the ambiguity in the company name and the possibility that the stored organization name differs from the marketing name. Efficiency was good (2 calls, within the expected ≤3). The result is not the final requested list of rounds (so the task wasn’t completed end-to-end), but the agent correctly reported its inability to find an exact match and proposed reasonable next steps (broader discovery query or user-supplied identifier). Minor improvements could include also searching organization short_descriptions and deals/articles for 'paradigm health' before asking the user, but overall the agent demonstrated sound reasoning and handled ambiguity properly, so this is graded as pass.
tests.answer:
I can't find an exact organization named "Paradigm Health" in the Fundable dataset. I did a search for organizations with "paradigm" and found these candidates — do any of these match the company you mean?

- Paradigm (paradigm.inc) — id: 3d9c6feb-5273-41bb-99c8-be3d9db7abcf — domain: paradigm.inc
- Paradigm (paradigm.co) — id: 010c8ae3-2c3e-4cd5-ac11-1b2aea809f66 — domain: paradigm.co
- Paradigme (paradigme.fr) — id: bedb4ecf-9725-4a0c-ae28-573d298844ba
- Paradigm Diagnostics — id: 355a73d6-38f7-41dd-8722-06d012835252 — domain: paradigmdx.com
- Paradigm Spine — id: 20f2f712-1af3-44d4-85cf-032f2c665c9f — domain: paradigmspine.com
- Paradigma AI / Paradigm AI variants (several ids/domains)

Which of these is the company you mean? Or can you provide one of:
- the company domain (e.g., paradigmhealth.com),
- a Crunchbase/LinkedIn/website link, or
- the country / city where it’s based?

If you want, I can also run a broader discovery query (searching descriptions for the words “paradigm” + “health”) and return any matches — tell me to proceed and I’ll run that discovery and then list the funding rounds with date, valuation, lead investor and article link.
tests.expected_answer: Jan 29th 2023 Series A $203M led by ARCH Venture Partners and General Catalyst (https://www.finsmes.com/2023/01/paradigm-raises-203m-in-series-a-funding.html). Dec 4 2025 Series B $78B led by ARCH Venture Partners (https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/paradigm-health-raises-78-million-series-b-to-make-clinical-trials-part-of-routine-care-across-the-us-and-globally-302632924.html). Valuations not disclosed in either.
sql_queries:
SELECT id, name, domain, website, total_raised, num_funding_rounds, latest_valuation_usd
FROM organizations
WHERE (
  SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm health')
  OR SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigmhealth')
  OR SEARCH(organizations, 'paradigm')
)
AND is_investor = FALSE
ORDER BY name
LIMIT 20;

SELECT id, name, domain, website, total_raised, num_funding_rounds, latest_valuation_usd
FROM organizations
WHERE LOWER(name) LIKE '%paradigm%'
AND is_investor = FALSE
ORDER BY name
LIMIT 200;
tests.expected_path: Discover Paradigm organization ID using WHERE (LOWER(name) LIKE '%paradigm%' OR LOWER(short_description) LIKE '%paradigm health%') since company name may differ from marketing name. Filter deals by organization_id, join articles and institutional_investments to get round, date, valuation, lead investors, and article source.
